question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure the code you generate is executable for demonstration. Please help me write code for a webpage that controls an ESP32 car with ultrasonic sensors and line tracking sensors. The car uses a DRV8833 motor driver chip.

checklist.title: Is the ESP32 web control interface fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code properly implements a responsive web interface with directional controls (forward, backward, left, right), speed adjustment, and emergency stop functionality. Check if WebSocket/HTTP communication is correctly established for real-time control. Score 0 if basic controls are missing, 5 if only basic movement controls are implemented, and 10 if all controls including speed adjustment and emergency stop are properly implemented.

checklist.title: Is the ultrasonic sensor data visualization properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code effectively displays real-time ultrasonic sensor data through visual indicators (gauges, numerical displays, or radar-like visualizations). Check if distance thresholds for obstacle detection are properly configured and if warning indicators are shown when obstacles are detected. Deduct 3 points if visualization is missing, 3 points if data is not updated in real-time, and 2 points if warning indicators are absent. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the line tracking sensor feedback and control system implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the webpage displays the status of line tracking sensors and provides an automatic line-following mode option. Verify if the interface shows the current tracking status and allows toggling between manual and line-following modes. Deduct 5 points if sensor feedback visualization is missing, and 5 points if the automatic line-following control feature is not implemented. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the DRV8833 motor driver control logic correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code correctly translates web interface commands to appropriate PWM signal instructions for the DRV8833 motor driver chip. Check for proper mapping of directional controls to motor outputs, speed control implementation, and motor protection features (overcurrent detection). Deduct 5 points if PWM control is improperly implemented, 3 points if motor protection features are missing, and 2 points if speed control is inaccurate. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as connection loss, sensor failure, invalid input values, etc.) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should implement timeout handling, reconnection mechanisms, and sensor error detection. Give 10 points for comprehensive error handling, 5 points for average robustness, and 0 points if no exception handling exists.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Real-time path mapping/tracking visualization 2. Camera integration for remote viewing 3. Customizable autonomous navigation patterns 4. Battery level monitoring and alerts). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple control systems overlapping) 2. Function modules unrelated to car control (e.g., unnecessary animations or features) 3. Heavy frontend effects that could impact performance on mobile devices or cause latency in control. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core control functions are compromised by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating UI/control logic/communication layers), error logging, and responsive design implementation. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or if proper design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the interface is not responsive across different devices. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional control layout with clear visual hierarchy (primary controls prominently displayed). Deduct 3 points for each poorly positioned control element, 5 points for an unclear or visually jarring interface, and 5 points for controls that are difficult to use on touch devices. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and responsive?
checklist.description: Judge whether the control interface provides immediate feedback and responsiveness: 1) Command execution delay â‰¤ 100ms 2) Visual feedback for all user actions 3) Real-time sensor data updates at least every 200ms. Deduct 5 points for noticeable control latency, 3 points for missing visual feedback on controls, and 5 points for sensor data that updates too slowly or inconsistently. The full score is 10 points.
